Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀 About Teya

Teya exists to make sure that every small and growing business in Europe has the opportunity to thrive. We want to become Europe’s go-to software solution for these businesses, simplifying their every day and helping them reconnect with the joy of running their business. Teya was born in 2019 and is home to over 1,000 employees in 15+ countries. We've built a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative environment that is dedicated to bringing the best solutions to customers.




🤝 About the Team

Join a team of machine learning engineers building a real-time decision making platform in Go and Python for fraud detection and mitigation models to protect merchants, their customers, and Teya from fraudulent activities. Working with advanced predictive models and scalable software systems, build and grow intelligent solutions to reduce all kinds of risk and allow Teya to focus on effectively serving our merchants. Key individual contributor for a diverse and innovative team of machine learning engineers to continuously improve and address fast-moving risks and opportunities. Work with senior engineering leaders to design, implement, launch, iterate, and ensure engineering and operational excellence for critical systems with high standards for availability, throughput, and reliability. Collaborate with your peers across Teya to build systems that can integrate real-time decision making wherever opportunity arises.




💪 Your Mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer on the Fraud Prevention team you will:

Join in the early stage design of a platform for real time decision making including fraud evaluation.
Build high quality solutions using technologies such as Go, Python, Kafka, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Work with dedicated Product Managers to deliver scalable platforms and services to build and execute advanced predictive models.
Help build a culture of quality and delivery.
Work with best in class tools for observability, monitoring, and analysis.




📖 Your Story

2+ years of professional software development experience with machine learning systems.
Ability to solve problems in code using data structures and algorithms and be able to analyze the time and space complexity of those solutions.
Understanding of software system design including object-oriented, functional, and distributed design principles.
Able to work autonomously with little supervision.




🏆 The Perks

We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Arbolus

Arbolus is reinventing the traditional and analog expert network industry by bringing technology to the forefront of knowledge sharing. Our platform helps hundreds of clients worldwide to connect with the best experts, collect high-quality insights faster, and streamline their processes using leading AI technology.




Headquartered in London, we are a venture-backed scale-up working with global consulting and leading private equity firms. With offices in Barcelona, New York, and Gurgaon, we have a truly international team of over 150 people.

Recently listed as one of Europe’s top 100 fastest-growing companies, we are building a team that can continue to support our ambitious growth plans.




About the role

You will be a creator of data visualization dashboards and looking over extracting data insights to identify strategic opportunities. You will also leverage advanced statistics and machine-learning techniques to uncover data patterns and create machine-learning models.




Key responsibilities you will be in charge of

Proactively investigate and analyze business trends to find actionable insights
Support the company by creating dashboards and enabling data-driven decision-making.
Collect, clean, and merge data to validate hypotheses & designs
Create and maintain Machine Learning models




About you

We are looking for an ambitious individual with great business and technical skills, and the ability to analyze different sources of information, create visualizations, and explain their findings to the stakeholders.




Requirements to succeed in this role

Bachelor's degree in computer science, maths engineering, or a quantitative field
2+ years experience in a data scientist role
Knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases
Experience with Python or R and Machine Learning libraries (Scikit-Learn, XGBoost, Keras, PyTorch, etc.)
Experience with HuggingFace and other Machine Learning tools
The ability to effectively communicate your analyses to business and technical audiences
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
Self-driven, agile, and able to work independently and on multiple engagements simultaneously

Nice to have

Proficient with Excel or Google Spreadsheets
Basic understanding of SQL pipelines (DBT) and other software development tools, such as git
Experience with business intelligence platforms (e.g. Tableau, Google Data Studio, or similar)
Experience applying a wide range of statistical techniques to data sets, and understanding their real-world advantages/drawbacks




What we offer

Variable bonus on top of your base salary
25 days of paid time off per year + all local bank holidays. Arbolus puts heavy emphasis on quality of life and wants to ensure everyone has a fair amount of time to recharge and relax
Flexibility with local bank holidays
Share option plan for all employees
Private health insurance
Flexible remuneration for meals and transport
Relocation package to help you with your move to Barcelona
2 weeks per year to work from abroad
Top-notch equipment to make our work efficient and smooth
Free coffee, tea, and snacks to boost our energy during the day
Monday office breakfast to start our week and Friday lunch voucher
Regular social activities managed by our local Social Committees
Language courses to extend our knowledge (English, Spanish, French, and Catalan)
Office First organization




Arbolus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

*Please be advised that at this moment Arbolus is not able to provide support in the visa sponsorship process.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About The Job

Data Scientist

Rijswijk / Brussels + Hybrid

About The Job

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join our team to design and develop data-driven solutions and deliver insights that support Danone Benelux. You will be responsible for the entire data science lifecycle, from data acquisition and data processing to advanced analytics, modeling, and deploying machine learning models into production.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, analysts, and subject matter experts, to understand business problems and translate them into data science solutions. You will leverage your expertise in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and data mining techniques to extract valuable insights from complex and diverse data sources. Develop key dashboards and visualize frameworks for the leadership teams.

Responsibilities


Lead data science projects by developing and applying data-driven solutions to deliver insights for high-priority commercial analytics business questions.
Data wrangling including data cleansing, transformation, data sources integration, pipeline building, and process automation.
Design and implement advanced analytical models, machine learning and data products, tools, and techniques to deliver insights and enhance existing processes.
Architect, design, and develop scalable, interactive reports and dashboards using Power BI, Datorama, and Looker that are intuitive and meet established UI/UX objectives.
Develop and deploy models on customer data platforms and build up the robustness of the platform with audience and segmentation logic.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams (data engineering, product owners, business stakeholders) to understand data requirements, translate data into actionable insights, and deliver impactful results.
Ensure the quality, integrity, and accuracy of data used in all analytics projects by implementing data governance standards and best practices.
Communicate complex analytical findings and insights to a diverse audience (technical and non-technical stakeholders) through compelling data visualizations, reports, and presentations.
Continuously monitor and evaluate deployed models, making improvements as necessary to optimize performance and ensure they deliver maximum value.


Meet your future manager! As a Data Scientist you’ll report to Yury Lebedev, Senior Data & Analytics Manager.

Qualifications

About you


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field, with a Master's or Ph.D. highly preferred.
3+ years of experience in data science or a related role, with a proven track record of delivering impactful data-driven solutions.
Proficiency in Python and SQL, experience in data manipulation and analysis libraries (Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn).
Ability to create compelling data visualizations and reports using tools like Power BI, Datorama, and Looker.
Experience applying statistical methods and experimental design principles to real-world business problems.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into clear and understandable language for all levels within the organization.


Preferred Qualifications


Relevant data and process experience from Consumer Goods, Banking, Telecom or IT Consulting industries.
Experience with cloud platforms and cloud data services (Azure, Databricks, Informatica, Snowflake, BigQuery) Hands-on experience with machine learning frameworks and tools (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.) and familiarity with model deployment and monitoring practices.
Familiarity with big data technologies and experience working with large-scale data processing environments.
Knowledge of specific industry data sources and structures (Nielsen, IQVIA, and similar).
Certification in data science, machine learning, or cloud computing (Azure, Databricks).
Project management and experience with version control tools (Git, Confluence, Asana).


About us

About Us

Working at Danone is a unique experience. It’s fast-paced and complex and, at times, it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities to learn and grow working with some of the best-known brands in the world, like Evian, Alpro, Nutricia, Activia and Nutrilon. Bring your unique perspective, ambitions and entrepreneurial ideas to the table – the impact you could make might just surprise you. One Planet. One Health – BY YOU.

We’re proud to be a B-Corp certified company. That means we meet the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability in everything we do.

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we base our hiring decisions on merit, job requirements and business needs.*

We Offer

It’s an exciting time to join Danone as a Data Scientist. And the best part? You’ll be supported to grow an impactful career that you can be proud of. Together, we’ll build a healthier world. All Danoners receive a complete package of benefits. This includes a competitive salary and yearly bonus, a premium free pension and great discounts on health insurance and Danone products. We understand the importance of flexibility and offer 30 days of annual leave (with the opportunity to purchase more) and a hybrid working environment, where you can work either from home or from one of our People Hubs in Hoofddorp, Utrecht, Rijswijk or Brussels.

What’s next?

It’s simple – hit the “apply” button before the application deadline of 27 September 2024. In order to comply with GDPR we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via careers website. Good luck! We can’t wait to meet you. Need more information? Please contact Elif Oruc, Talent Manager via elif.oruc@danone.com.


all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Overview:

In FRISS, we enable insurers worldwide to automatically detect potential insurance fraud. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance. Are you ready for an adventure? We are on the hunt for a Machine Learning Engineer!







Position Overview:

This role offers the flexibility to work from our vibrant office in Utrecht, Netherlands, or remotely from home. As part of our collaborative team, you will have the opportunity to share knowledge and work alongside other AI practitioners.







Key Responsibilities:

Implement scalable and efficient Machine Learning (ML) models.
Contribute to our in-house code libraries following good software development principles and practices.
Deploy our ML models in the cloud and monitor their performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML solutions into products.







Requirements:

Great understanding of and experience in building ML (and deep learning) models.
Excellent programming skills in Python; knowledge in SQL and Py/Spark is a plus.
Hands-on experience with MLOps; CI/CD pipelines, model deployment and monitoring.
Prior work using ML frameworks such as PyTorch (or Keras), Scikit-learn, pandas.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
Excellent communication skills in English.







Preferred Qualifications:

Knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs), efficient ML (quantization, distillation etc.) and transfer learning and fine-tuning.
Experience with Azure Services including Azure Datalake/Datahouse and Azure Databricks.
Experience with Rest API.
Familiarity with containerized (Docker) applications and Kubernetes.







What We Offer:

A stimulating and innovative work environment.
Flexible working options: 50/50 work from our Utrecht office or home.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative team culture where knowledge sharing is encouraged.







Apply Now:

If you are ready to play a crucial role at FRISS, we want to hear from you! Apply now via recruitment@friss.com to become our ML Engineer at FRISS and make a meaningful impact on our success.




Please note; We are only accepting applications from candidates based in the Netherlands.







About FRISS:

FRISS is a leading provider in fraud detection and risk mitigation solutions for the insurance industry. Founded in 2006, FRISS holds its head office in Utrecht, The Netherlands, with a global presence and global workforce, including Europe, the United States, Canada, Australia, and New Zealand. Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Our ultimate dream is that the FRISS Score is the global trusted standard for honest insurance.

To learn more about FRISS, have a look at www.friss.com.

FRISS is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage you to be yourself. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, religious affiliation, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, nationality, or veteran status.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
The Opportunity

As a Junior Data Scientist, you will be joining our Analytics department working on a hybrid basis in Madrid. This role requires a high degree of proficiency in both Spanish and English and we would invite you to submit your application in English.




You will play a crucial role in helping us achieve our goals and deliver success on behalf of our customers by building advanced statistical models and algorithms that infer and predict individual customer behaviours in real-time, based on retail, online and ecommerce transaction data.




We are experiencing a continued period of great success winning big deals with customers in Latin America, as well as across the EMEA region. This has been a big factor in our decision to build an Analytics presence in Spain to support our customers. For this role you will be working with global customers that require periodic work outside of standard hours (evening work).




Day to Day

Applying analytical theory to diverse real-world problems on large and dynamic datasets
Generating integral work products from project kick-off through to live deployment
Contributing to the development of statistical models and algorithms for integration within Featurespace products
End-to-end processing and modelling of large customer data sets
Producing materials to feedback analytic output to customers (reports, presentations, visualizations)
Working collaboratively with customers to develop and optimize models tailored to their data
Evaluating and improving analytical results on live systems
Developing an understanding of industry data structures and processes
Working with engineering/development teams to support and enhance the analytical infrastructure
Testing analytical models and their integration within the ARIC platform




About you

Must haves:

Good degree in a scientific or numerate discipline (e.g. Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent work experience
Strong, clear, concise written and verbal communication skills in both English and Spanish
Evidence of interest in machine learning
Experience in utilising statistical models and analytical algorithms in software
Experience using Python, Java, R or another major programming language for data analysis, machine learning or algorithm development
Technical and analytical skills with the ability to pick up new technologies and concepts quickly
Problem-solving skills (especially in data-centric applications)
Strong communication skills
Ability to manage and prioritise personal workload




Great to haves:

Exposure to the handling of large, diverse, real-world data sets
Experience working in a Linux command line environment
Experience using SQL to analyse data
Experience with version control software and workflows (e.g. git)




Equal Opportunities

Here at Featurespace we are committed to being a place of equality, inclusion and respect to provide a safe environment for you to bring your authentic self to work. We know that we gain as much strength from our differences as we do our similarities. We value diversity and are dedicated to listening and learning from each other to build and maintain a positive and productive culture. We appreciate this will be an ever-evolving focus for the business to ensure everyone feels supported and has a sense of belonging.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Threat Intelligence team)
HTML:
Our Threat Intelligence team is dedicated to providing accurate and timely information on potential threats to our products. Our team of skilled professionals from various fields, including Data Science, Malware Research, Development, and Privacy, are focused on achieving a common goal by utilizing feeds, heuristics, algorithms, and machine learning.

Main Responsibilities

  • Design solutions to problems while researching, debugging, and analyzing data using different data sources;
  • Take ownership of projects from idea to completion, demonstrating the ability to oversee all aspects of the project lifecycle, including planning, execution, monitoring, and delivery;
  • Create scalable & reliable code, as well as writing documentation for the parts that you’ve contributed to or explored;
  • Research, develop & deliver data science solutions to production;
  • Develops custom ML metrics that would help to monitor model performance;
  • Analyze validation/testing results, explain them and improve model design accordingly;
  • Plan the deliverables with the team members;
  • Code reviews;
  • Constant communication about the progress;
  • Mentoring & knowledge sharing;
  • Suggest improvements of current solutions




Core Requirements

  • At least 3 years of experience of data science or mathematical modeling;
  • Solid knowledge of statistics (e.g., Monte Carlo, hypothesis testing, bootstrap, Bayesian inference);
  • In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in machine learning algorithms: linear regression, random forest, gradient boosted trees, neural networks, k-means, etc.;
  • Proficient in deep learning methodologies with a comprehensive understanding and extensive practical experience in their application;
  • Proficiency in Python and hands-on experience of the PyData stack (e.g., Pandas, Numpy, MatPlotLib, Spark) for analytics/machine learning;
  • Experience in cloud services ( we use AWS );
  • Excellent problem-solving skills (researching, debugging, instrumentation);
  • Ability to break down and prioritize work, make informed decisions about which tools and algorithms to use for specific problems;
  • Willingness to explore, grow, and mentor others while keeping up with the latest innovations in data science




Bonus Points For


  • Understanding of networking and internet protocols
  • Ability to highlight potential problems in machine learning solutions at early stages
  • Released & maintained machine learning services in production




Salary Range


  • Monthly gross salary from 17300-29800 PLN




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.

NordVPN is the world’s most advanced VPN service provider, used by millions of internet users worldwide. NordVPN provides double VPN encryption and Onion Over VPN and guarantees privacy with zero tracking. One of the key features of the product is Threat Protection, which blocks malicious websites, malware, trackers, and ads. NordVPN is very user friendly, offers one of the best prices on the market, and has over 5,000 servers in 59 countries worldwide.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand, at no charge;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, sports access card, online workouts, consultations, programs to improve mental health to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (All Levels)
Description:
Use AI & advanced ML techniques to level-up experiences for millions of customers around the world! Projects including the introduction of Gen-AI, LLMs, advanced classic models and more.




🚨 Machine Learning Engineers - All Levels 🚨




Currently based in Portugal, or thinking of finding some sun in the booming tech hubs of Lisbon & Porto? ☀️




Interested in working on the cutting-edge application of AI & advanced ML?




💰 Salary: from €45,000 to €75,000 + bonuses, depending on level & experience

💻 Benefits: 20%+ bonus, health & life insurance

🚀 Industry/Type of business: Tech & gaming

🏠 Remote working: Hybrid or remote, Portugal (Lisbon HQ)

🧩 Interview process: 3 stages

📢 Reporting to: Head of AI

👏 Company size: ~2500

🎯 Working on: Developing AI products to be deployed across a range of business functions, including security, customer & marketing, gaming and more!




What are we looking for?




- Proficiency across the end-to-end ML project life cycle, including hands-on experience with MLOps

- Strong experience working with Python

- Exposure to Azure ML (we are open to AWS & GCP experience too!)

- Knowledge of Spark, DataBricks, SQL etc.




Interested in hearing more? Apply!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

InfoNet provides innovative software solutions for companies of all sizes, from startups to Forbes 500 enterprises. Since 1996, we have been dedicated to helping businesses streamline operations, enhance customer experiences, and drive growth through cutting-edge technology. Our team delivers bespoke solutions tailored to each client's unique needs, focusing on enterprise applications, cloud infrastructure, AI integration, and digital transformation.




Role Description

This is a full-time hybrid role for a Data Scientist at InfoNet in Wrocław. The Data Scientist will be responsible for tasks such as data analysis, statistical modeling, data visualization, and utilizing data analytics to drive insights. This role offers flexibility for some remote work.




Qualifications

Data Science, Statistics, and Data Analysis skills
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities

  • Data Science, Statistics, and Data Analysis skills

Title: Data Scientist (Trust & Transparency)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

A core value proposition of Trustpilot is Trust. We work hard to ensure that our platform has genuine content from real people with real experiences. That means eliminating fake reviews and acting on signs of suspicious behavior to protect our platform from fraudulent activity. Our Trust Applied AI team’s mission is to use advanced modeling to safeguard the integrity of online reviews, and we have several cross-functional teams devoted to Trust where Applied AI is integral to achieving our goals.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our Trust team. You and your team will work to develop, deploy, and maintain innovative models at scale, alongside a cross-functional team of software developers, product managers, ML engineers, and designers. You will have the opportunity to collaborate widely across the business with our Technology and Product teams. You will also work closely with stakeholders in Legal and Platform Integrity.

To succeed in this role, you should have proven experience in developing and deploying ML models. You need a strong technical foundation and hands-on experience in all stages of data preparation, exploration, and modeling. An adaptable mindset and understanding of the interface between Applied AI and engineering are essential as you will be working in cross-disciplinary teams. Experience with deploying solutions into production is expected, as you will be responsible for implementing end-to-end solutions—from data pre-processing to serving predictions.

What You Will Do


Be hands-on in delivering the Applied AI / Data Science component of key strategic projects in Trust, from building and fine-tuning language models to sequence modeling, anomaly detection, collaborative filtering, user segmentation, etc.
Develop, maintain, and deploy production-ready ML models, with tooling support from ML engineers
Engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders and contribute to the Trust roadmap
Seize the chance to meaningfully influence our business through the latest advancements in Applied AI and keep Trustpilot on the edge of innovation when it comes to fake review detection
The opportunity to work with market-standard data engineering and deployment technologies including Google Vertex AI tools, Google BigQuery, and AWS, and with leading Data Science tools and emerging technologies for model building and deployment
Opportunities to develop your career in a friendly, diverse, international team and workplace


Who You Are


Experience with analysis and quantitative problem-solving using advanced statistical techniques and machine learning methods, e.g. anomaly detection, sequence modeling, classification, and semi-supervised/active learning, as well as deep learning methods (e.g. for language problems and graphs)
Experience in building and deploying production-ready ML models at scale, and solid data engineering skills (e.g. experience with cloud technologies - we use GCP but experience with AWS or Azure will also be fine)
Ability in Python and SQL for data manipulation, modeling, and scripting
Experience in working with large datasets, ideally from tech platforms, e-commerce, or SaaS-type businesses. Knowledge of behavioral data, detecting misbehavior or fraud at scale is a big plus
Knowledge of data pipelining and prior experience with cloud-based ML model deployments
Great communication skills - both with technical colleagues and with business stakeholders
Proven 3+ years of technical experience in a Data Science role, particularly in the technology sector or in a technical consultancy


What's In It For You


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

We offer flexibility and are offering these roles to work hybrid with a mixture of office and remote working, or if you are looking to be fully remote we are open to discussing this too! (As long as you are based in the UK or Denmark)

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 67 million monthly active users across the globe, with 127 billion annual Trustpilot brand impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 900 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Title: Data Scientist IA (F/H)
Description:
Descriptif de poste :




Le groupe RENAULT entre dans une nouvelle ère grâce à la stratégie RENAULuTion qui place L’IA au cœur de notre business. Renault Digital, créé en 2017, est un acteur incontournable de ce nouveau cycle et participe activement à relever les challenges des nouvelles mobilités et de l’industrie 4.0




Contexte :




Vous travaillez au sein du Centre d’excellence IA, dans une équipe de 30 data Scientists et data Analysts dont les missions principales sont d’une part la réalisation d’enablers IA permettant de déployer l’IA à l’échelle dans le groupe, et d’autre part de participer à la réalisation de projets métiers en collaboration avec les équipes data sciences locales. Vous serez garant(e) de la valeur ajoutée de la donnée et de l’intelligence artificielle appliquée dans les processus métiers.

Votre mission principale, dans un premier temps, sera d'explorer et de benchmarker les solutions dans le domaine de GEN AI et LLM, et de faciliter leur intégration rapide dans l'architecture existante du groupe RENAULT. Le/la Data Scientist IA travaillera également en étroite collaboration avec l'écosystème externe, y compris les laboratoires de recherche, les IRT et les sociétés du CAC 40.




Responsabilités principales :




Vous explorez et benchmarkez les solutions existantes dans le domaine de GEN AI et LLM.
Vous facilitez l'intégration rapide de ces solutions dans l'architecture existante de RENAULT.
Vous développez une stratégie pour l'adoption et l'intégration des nouvelles technologies IA.
Vous gérez toutes les activités du Lab IA, y compris la planification et le suivi du budget.
Vous collaborez avec d'autres départements et équipes pour garantir l'alignement des activités du Lab IA, avec les objectifs stratégiques de RENAULT.
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec l'écosystème externe, y compris les laboratoires de recherche, les IRT et les sociétés du CAC 40.




Profil recherché :




Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur avec une spécialisation Machine Learning ou PHD en ML.
Vous disposez de 2 à 5 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist et Machine Learning dont 6 mois à 1 an en Gen AI & LLM
Vous avez une expérience réussie dans l’animation d'équipes techniques.
Vous possédez une expérience dans l'exploration et le benchmarking de solutions IA.
Vous êtes capable de collaborer efficacement avec une équipe multidisciplinaire.
Vous possédez une expérience / ou capacité démontrée à travailler en collaboration avec des laboratoires de recherche, des IRT et des sociétés du CAC 40.
Vous avez une capacité d’écoute et de compréhension de problématiques business variées (industrie 4.0, marketing, engineering, qualité, après-vente, …)
Vous êtes capable de vulgariser et présenter de nouvelles approches et simplifier les résultats
Vous disposez d’une connaissance approfondie des technologies GEN AI et LLM et en particulier des architectures RAG
Vous avez des connaissances approfondies des algorithmes de machine learning (clustering,classification, régression, détection d’anomalie, optimisation de modèles, traitement d’images et de langage naturel avec du deep learning).
Vous avez une expérience avec au moins l'un des langages de programmation suivants : Python (obligatoire), SQL (obligatoire), R, Scala ou Java.
Vous possédez une expérience sur des frameworks de Machine Learning bien connus : Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/Keras, TFx, PyTorch(un plus) …
Vous avez une expérience en industrialisation de systèmes de machine learning
Vous disposez d’une expérience avec Docker, et un orchestrateur (kubeflow, airflow …), kubernetes, Git, Gitlab CI/CD (un plus)
Vous utilisez Google Cloud Platform (Storage, BigQuery,Dataproc, Dataflow, AI Platform, …)
Vous avez des connaissances sur les outils DevOps pour AI et ML (MLOps)
Vous êtes capable d’échanger en anglais technique écrit et oral




Informations complémentaires

Votre poste sera basé à Boulogne-Billancourt (France) en CDI (temps plein)
Vous bénéficiez de 2 à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine

Show more
HTML:
Descriptif de poste :


Le groupe RENAULT entre dans une nouvelle ère grâce à la stratégie RENAULuTion qui place L’IA au cœur de notre business. Renault Digital, créé en 2017, est un acteur incontournable de ce nouveau cycle et participe activement à relever les challenges des nouvelles mobilités et de l’industrie 4.0


Contexte :


Vous travaillez au sein du Centre d’excellence IA, dans une équipe de 30 data Scientists et data Analysts dont les missions principales sont d’une part la réalisation d’enablers IA permettant de déployer l’IA à l’échelle dans le groupe, et d’autre part de participer à la réalisation de projets métiers en collaboration avec les équipes data sciences locales. Vous serez garant(e) de la valeur ajoutée de la donnée et de l’intelligence artificielle appliquée dans les processus métiers.

Votre mission principale, dans un premier temps, sera d'explorer et de benchmarker les solutions dans le domaine de GEN AI et LLM, et de faciliter leur intégration rapide dans l'architecture existante du groupe RENAULT. Le/la Data Scientist IA travaillera également en étroite collaboration avec l'écosystème externe, y compris les laboratoires de recherche, les IRT et les sociétés du CAC 40.


Responsabilités principales :


  • Vous explorez et benchmarkez les solutions existantes dans le domaine de GEN AI et LLM.
  • Vous facilitez l'intégration rapide de ces solutions dans l'architecture existante de RENAULT.
  • Vous développez une stratégie pour l'adoption et l'intégration des nouvelles technologies IA.
  • Vous gérez toutes les activités du Lab IA, y compris la planification et le suivi du budget.
  • Vous collaborez avec d'autres départements et équipes pour garantir l'alignement des activités du Lab IA, avec les objectifs stratégiques de RENAULT.
  • Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec l'écosystème externe, y compris les laboratoires de recherche, les IRT et les sociétés du CAC 40.


Profil recherché :


  • Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur avec une spécialisation Machine Learning ou PHD en ML.
  • Vous disposez de 2 à 5 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Scientist et Machine Learning dont 6 mois à 1 an en Gen AI & LLM
  • Vous avez une expérience réussie dans l’animation d'équipes techniques.
  • Vous possédez une expérience dans l'exploration et le benchmarking de solutions IA.
  • Vous êtes capable de collaborer efficacement avec une équipe multidisciplinaire.
  • Vous possédez une expérience / ou capacité démontrée à travailler en collaboration avec des laboratoires de recherche, des IRT et des sociétés du CAC 40.
  • Vous avez une capacité d’écoute et de compréhension de problématiques business variées (industrie 4.0, marketing, engineering, qualité, après-vente, …)
  • Vous êtes capable de vulgariser et présenter de nouvelles approches et simplifier les résultats
  • Vous disposez d’une connaissance approfondie des technologies GEN AI et LLM et en particulier des architectures RAG
  • Vous avez des connaissances approfondies des algorithmes de machine learning (clustering,classification, régression, détection d’anomalie, optimisation de modèles, traitement d’images et de langage naturel avec du deep learning).
  • Vous avez une expérience avec au moins l'un des langages de programmation suivants : Python (obligatoire), SQL (obligatoire), R, Scala ou Java.
  • Vous possédez une expérience sur des frameworks de Machine Learning bien connus : Scikit-learn, TensorFlow/Keras, TFx, PyTorch(un plus) …
  • Vous avez une expérience en industrialisation de systèmes de machine learning
  • Vous disposez d’une expérience avec Docker, et un orchestrateur (kubeflow, airflow …), kubernetes, Git, Gitlab CI/CD (un plus)
  • Vous utilisez Google Cloud Platform (Storage, BigQuery,Dataproc, Dataflow, AI Platform, …)
  • Vous avez des connaissances sur les outils DevOps pour AI et ML (MLOps)
  • Vous êtes capable d’échanger en anglais technique écrit et oral


Informations complémentaires

  • Votre poste sera basé à Boulogne-Billancourt (France) en CDI (temps plein)
  • Vous bénéficiez de 2 à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine

Title: Data Scientist: Fraud Detection
Description:
Únete como Data Scientist: Fraud Detection a una compañía de elevada reputación en el sector del comercio omnicanal, donde tu principal función será desarrollar e implementar herramientas para detección de fraudes internos, contribuyendo a la mejora del funcionamiento de la empresa.

¿Cuáles serán tus principales funciones?:

Desarrollar e implementar herramienta para la detección de fraudes internos.
Monitorizar parte de la actividad para establecer alertas de posibles fraudes e incumplimientos.
Detectar incidencias en el sistema interno para prevenirlas.
Ayudar en las investigaciones internas de los Responsables de Control Interno a través del dato.
Desarrollar los proyectos del área de IA y robótica.
Parametrizar y gestionar la herramienta de autocontrol del grupo, automatizándola para ganar productividad en las tiendas.
Participar de manera activa en proyectos transversales.

¿Qué necesitamos de ti?

Formación académica en informática, matemática, ingeniería o relacionada.
Mínimo 3 años de experiencia en implementación de nuevas herramientas el área de Análisis de Datos, Auditorías o afines.
Conocimientos avanzados de Excel, técnicas analíticas y herramientas de visualización de datos.
Manejo del idioma inglés (B2).
Interés por la detección de fraudes.
Productividad, autonomia y organización.

Por ultimo, pero no menos importante, ofrecemos:

Ambiente laboral dinámico y colaborativo con oportunidades de desarrollo profesional.
Contrato indefinido con remuneración competitiva acorde a la experiencia y responsabilidades.
Horario de trabajo flexible para promover el equilibrio entre vida laboral y personal.
Formación continua y acceso a recursos de aprendizaje.
Show more

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

á Perform primary data analysis of our data.

á Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

á Work with the team to improve data quality and data governance.

á Apply a mixture of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques to produce business insights that improves customer experience and product offerings.

á Present findings to business owners and stakeholder.

á Translate business questions into data resolutions and stories for non-technical stakeholders.

Skills:

á Background studies in Data Analysis, Data Science, Statistics or similar roles

á Strong knowledge of and experience in (academic experience or internship) reporting packages (such as Tableau, Qlik etc), databases (SQL), programming (such as R, Python etc)

á Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyse datasets (using Excel, SPSS, SAS, R or Python etc)

á Technical expertise such as data models, data mining and segmentation techniques are desirable

á Precise, a keen eye for detail and for numbers

á A willingness to learn & upskill constantly, curious by nature

á Strong team player with a solution focused attitude

á Great opportunity to be a part of global organisation

á Our Analytics team is very ambitious, the analytics needs will very soon be transitioning to advanced analytics. So, there is a great opportunity to transition to Data Scientist role.

Title: Data Scientist | Teletrabajo
Description:
¿Estás preparado para llevar tus habilidades como Data Science al siguiente nivel?




En ALTEN tenemos claro que el éxito de nuestros proyectos se debe a las personas que forman nuestro equipo. Por eso, si tienes al menos 2 años de experiencia como Data Science, nos comprometemos a impulsar tu talento, satisfacer tus expectativas laborales y hacerte sentir como en casa. ¿Quieres construir hoy el mundo de mañana? ¡Sigue leyendo!




¿Cuáles serían tus funciones?




Construir un bussines chat, un asistente virtual al que se le pueda preguntar por las situaciones que ya están contempladas y creadas anteriormente por otro equipo. Se llevará el end to end de ese caso de uso de esa herramienta, lo que conlleva hacer el front y mantenerlo, la ETL de la base de datos (Redis) sobre la que se alimenta el Front y usar algunas herramientas auxiliares como como Azure.




¿Qué buscamos?




Python.
Experiencia en ETL.
BBDD vectoriales como Redis.
Casos de uso de modelos de lenguaje LLM (Lanch lenaguaje models).
Azure alguna experiencia (Power Automate...).
Patrón RAG.
Inglés medio.




Valorable:

Fast Api.
Apache Airflow, Clickhouse, PowerBI, MLFlow.
Conocimientos sobre la gestión de clusters Spark.
Docker.
Cloud: Azure.




¿Cuál sería el modelo de trabajo?




Remoto




¿Qué podemos ofrecerte?




Formar parte de una gran empresa competitiva y en continuo crecimiento.
Integración en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificado, con un buen clima laboral, innovador y dinámico.
Formación especializada y desarrollo profesional continuo.
Beneficios sociales y plan de compensación flexible.
Salario competitivo




¿Quiénes somos?




Somos un equipo. Formamos parte de ALTEN, una multinacional europea especializada en proporcionar servicios de consultoría, tecnología de la información y servicios de ingeniería a las principales compañías del mercado español.




Si te gustan las cifras, te diremos que en España tenemos una facturación de 217 millones de euros, 9 sedes y un equipo formado por 5.240 personas.




Además, en ALTEN nos enorgullecemos de ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades con independencia de género, edad, diversidad de capacidades o país de origen. Nuestro compromiso está con el talento y con las personas que lo tienen.




📢Si crees que eres talento, ¡apúntate!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Global Consulting Partner - Madrid




Tech stack: Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist




Our client, one of the most known consultancy companies in the world is looking to expand their Data & Analytics team, bringing some professionals that want to work with the best clients in th emarket.




Our client is looking for talented, enthusiastic and passionate Data Scientists (Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist) to bring their services to the market and help enhance this already successful company!




Successful Data Scientists candidates should be able to demonstrate strong knowledge of: Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes




Training will be provided in any of the technologies you lack, allowing you to turn your technological weaknesses into your greatest strengths!




All Data Scientists positions come with the following benefits:




25 days holiday (plus Public Holidays)
REAL flexibility on how and when you work
Allowance for trainings/certifications/conferences
Insurance
Private medical




Location: Madrid, Spain / Hybrid Working




Salary: 49k for Seniors and above 50k for managers (with 20% bonus)




InterEx Group are Experts in Data, ERP and CRM, we are committed to supporting your career progression!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
🚀 About Teya

Teya exists to make sure that every small and growing business in Europe has the opportunity to thrive. We want to become Europe’s go-to software solution for these businesses, simplifying their every day and helping them reconnect with the joy of running their business. Teya was born in 2019 and is home to over 1,000 employees in 15+ countries. We've built a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative environment that is dedicated to bringing the best solutions to customers.




🤝 About the Team

Join a team of machine learning engineers building a real-time decision making platform in Go and Python for fraud detection and mitigation models to protect merchants, their customers, and Teya from fraudulent activities. Working with advanced predictive models and scalable software systems, build and grow intelligent solutions to reduce all kinds of risk and allow Teya to focus on effectively serving our merchants. Key individual contributor for a diverse and innovative team of machine learning engineers to continuously improve and address fast-moving risks and opportunities. Work with senior engineering leaders to design, implement, launch, iterate, and ensure engineering and operational excellence for critical systems with high standards for availability, throughput, and reliability. Collaborate with your peers across Teya to build systems that can integrate real-time decision making wherever opportunity arises.




💪 Your Mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer on the Fraud Prevention team you will:

Join in the early stage design of a platform for real time decision making including fraud evaluation.
Build high quality solutions using technologies such as Go, Python, Kafka, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Work with dedicated Product Managers to deliver scalable platforms and services to build and execute advanced predictive models.
Help build a culture of quality and delivery.
Work with best in class tools for observability, monitoring, and analysis.




📖 Your Story

2+ years of professional software development experience with machine learning systems.
Ability to solve problems in code using data structures and algorithms and be able to analyze the time and space complexity of those solutions.
Understanding of software system design including object-oriented, functional, and distributed design principles.
Able to work autonomously with little supervision.




🏆 The Perks

We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;
Health Insurance;
Meal Allowance;
25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);
Public Transportation Card;
Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;
Office snacks every day;
Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Arbolus

Arbolus is reinventing the traditional and analog expert network industry by bringing technology to the forefront of knowledge sharing. Our platform helps hundreds of clients worldwide to connect with the best experts, collect high-quality insights faster, and streamline their processes using leading AI technology.




Headquartered in London, we are a venture-backed scale-up working with global consulting and leading private equity firms. With offices in Barcelona, New York, and Gurgaon, we have a truly international team of over 150 people.

Recently listed as one of Europe’s top 100 fastest-growing companies, we are building a team that can continue to support our ambitious growth plans.




About the role

You will be a creator of data visualization dashboards and looking over extracting data insights to identify strategic opportunities. You will also leverage advanced statistics and machine-learning techniques to uncover data patterns and create machine-learning models.




Key responsibilities you will be in charge of

Proactively investigate and analyze business trends to find actionable insights
Support the company by creating dashboards and enabling data-driven decision-making.
Collect, clean, and merge data to validate hypotheses & designs
Create and maintain Machine Learning models




About you

We are looking for an ambitious individual with great business and technical skills, and the ability to analyze different sources of information, create visualizations, and explain their findings to the stakeholders.




Requirements to succeed in this role

Bachelor's degree in computer science, maths engineering, or a quantitative field
2+ years experience in a data scientist role
Knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases
Experience with Python or R and Machine Learning libraries (Scikit-Learn, XGBoost, Keras, PyTorch, etc.)
Experience with HuggingFace and other Machine Learning tools
The ability to effectively communicate your analyses to business and technical audiences
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
Self-driven, agile, and able to work independently and on multiple engagements simultaneously

Nice to have

Proficient with Excel or Google Spreadsheets
Basic understanding of SQL pipelines (DBT) and other software development tools, such as git
Experience with business intelligence platforms (e.g. Tableau, Google Data Studio, or similar)
Experience applying a wide range of statistical techniques to data sets, and understanding their real-world advantages/drawbacks




What we offer

Variable bonus on top of your base salary
25 days of paid time off per year + all local bank holidays. Arbolus puts heavy emphasis on quality of life and wants to ensure everyone has a fair amount of time to recharge and relax
Flexibility with local bank holidays
Share option plan for all employees
Private health insurance
Flexible remuneration for meals and transport
Relocation package to help you with your move to Barcelona
2 weeks per year to work from abroad
Top-notch equipment to make our work efficient and smooth
Free coffee, tea, and snacks to boost our energy during the day
Monday office breakfast to start our week and Friday lunch voucher
Regular social activities managed by our local Social Committees
Language courses to extend our knowledge (English, Spanish, French, and Catalan)
Office First organization




Arbolus is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

*Please be advised that at this moment Arbolus is not able to provide support in the visa sponsorship process.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer

Location: Bucharest, Romania




About the Team:

The AI & ML Products Development department is responsible for building and managing the ML Services platform for Cloud customers, as well as other companies within the United Internet group. We develop products featuring the integration of GenAI foundational models, LLMs, and others. We operate models such as Meta’s Llama, Mistral, and StableDiffusion on our private cloud infrastructure, offering access via APIs. Our team also works with classical ML models for Computer Vision, NLP, audio/voice processing, and predictions. We employ technologies such as HugginFace frameworks, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, and MLflow, while our platform side uses GoLang, Java, Spring Boot, Python, and SQL/PostgreSQL.




Responsibilities:

Implement AI/ML models in the cloud platform, providing API-based access to customers and internal clients.
Understand business use cases and select or test models, including GenAI and foundation models, based on industry trends.
Collaborate with colleagues to develop AI solutions in areas like forecasting, classification, recommender systems, and LLMs.
Deploy models into production using industry-standard or proprietary frameworks.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Product Owners and Architects, to define technical solutions aligned with the product vision.
Collaborate with international software developers and AI enthusiasts to deliver innovative solutions.




Key Requirements:

Experience with developing and applying classical ML models in areas such as Computer Vision, NLP, audio, and forecasting within cloud environments.
Strong knowledge and passion for foundation models, including GenAI, LLMs, text-to-image, and speech-to-text applications.
Proficiency with tools like Jupyter notebooks, Kubeflow, and MLflow.
Software development experience with Python or R, building AI/ML applications exposed via REST APIs.
Experience with cloud-native platforms and continuous delivery using Kubernetes.
Background in Computer Science, Mathematics, Machine Learning, or a related field.
Proficient in English, both written and verbal.




Preferred Skills:

Product-oriented development mindset with a strong sense of ownership.
Understanding of REST APIs, systems resilience, and scalability.
Full-stack development experience.
Openness to learning new concepts and technologies.
Collaborative and transparent communication style.




What We Offer:

Access to both technical and soft skills training, including international e-learning platforms.
Product responsibility and opportunities for growth.
Flexible work schedule and hybrid work option.
Medical services package from private providers.
25 vacation days per year, with additional days off for holidays that fall on weekends.
Meal tickets.
Internal referral program.
Team events, networking events, and seasonal parties.
Free coffee, soft drinks, and fresh fruits at the office.




About SmartChoice International:

SmartChoice International is your premier staffing agency and is committed to assembling the ideal team for your business while seamlessly connecting top-tier talent with exceptional opportunities. Boasting over two decades of profound experience in the staffing domain, we have established an eminent reputation as the go-to agency for enterprises in pursuit of unparalleled service.




At Smartchoice International, we recognize that each company's staffing requisites are unique. With this in mind, we are driven to offer tailored solutions precisely aligned with your distinct demands. Our operational prowess encompasses adaptability, flexibility, and efficiency, empowering us to maintain absolute control throughout the process - streamlining everything from interview preparation to comprehensive post-hire support.




https://www.smartchoice-international.com/




How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter detailing your relevant experience to ankur.singh@smartchoice-international.com.




Join our dynamic team and contribute to shaping the future of financial technology through your expertise and dedication.




Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further steps in the selection process.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (m/f)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet with their needs and expectations.

This project is for the telecommunications and business development sector. Here you will contact with the development of products and services focused on real needs in areas such as connectivity, operations support systems, service platforms, among others.

If you've always been interested in the telecom area and would like to, not only to see it up close, but also to contribute to the development of the most innovative products and services in the field, this is the project for you.

We are hiring a Machine Learning Engineer for this nacional project in Aveiro.

Requirements

  • Master's degree or higher degree in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field;
  • Between 0 to 4 years of professional experience in software development;
  • Proficiency with Python and basic libraries for Machine Learning;
  • Knowledge of Golang, SQL, Bash, Javascript and Typescript;
  • Knowledge of PostgreSQL;
  • Knowledge of a Message broker such as Kafka
  • Familiarity with Linux;
  • Experience with Git, CI/CD, Jira;
  • Familiar with Agile methodologies.

What You Can Expect From Us

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Exclusive discounts and offers from our partners;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us.

If you are ready for this challenge, apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - LLM
Description:
LLM - Python for Machine Learning

Experience: 2 - 15 Years

Location- Permanent Remote Anywhere in the world

Contract Duration: 6 Months

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 5 hours Mandatory overlap with PST

Total Years Of exp- 2+ years Mandatory

Mandatory Skills- Python: min 2 years, Python for Data Science: min 1 yr, Machine Learning: min 1 yr, PyTorch: min 1 yr, Keras: min 1 yr, Tensorflow: min 1 yr

Key skills: Python, ML, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow

Job Responsibilities


Develop, train, and deploy machine learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Implement machine learning models and preprocessing pipelines using Scikit-learn.
Apply supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, including SVM, Decision Trees, Random Forest, and k-NN, to solve complex problems.
Design and implement deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, GANs, and transfer learning models.
Explore and apply reinforcement learning techniques to enhance AI solutions.


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 2+ years of experience as a Python-focused Engineer.
1+ years of experience with Python-based frameworks for machine learning.
Proficiency in TensorFlow and/or PyTorch for model development and deployment.
Strong knowledge of Scikit-learn for machine learning model implementation.
In-depth understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, as well as deep learning architectures.


Nice To Have


Experience with Keras for quick prototyping of deep learning models.
Proficiency in Pandas and Numpy for data manipulation and preprocessing.
Familiarity with Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications in AI.
Excellent spoken and written English communication skills.


Skills: decision trees,algorithms,scikit-learn,transfer learning,rnns,k-nn,data science,random forest,keras,cnns,learning,reinforcement learning,ml,python,tensorflow,large language models (llms),numpy,unsupervised learning,machine learning,svm,pandas,supervised learning,gans,deep learning,pytorch

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Why Recharge.com

We are the leading one-stop-shop for branded payments, making online recharge possible for anyone, anywhere at any time — whether you or someone you love needs credit for calling, gaming, entertainment or money. This is your chance to join an ambitious scaleup in a state of rapid growth; we’ll push you to develop yourself and help you create a real impact in your role. Put simply: we could write history together.

We won’t bore you with a corporate spiel about how we might be taking on the world of branded payments (spoiler: we are). Instead, we’ll let the numbers speak for themselves: we bring consumers their favourite brands to their fingertips, with over 15,000 products available in every gift card category globally, $70 million in funding (and counting!), 20%+ growth in 2023. We also have a revenue target of €75 million in 2024, we're just getting started with 1.1 million app downloads in 2023, we are counting 5.0+ million active customers, a presence in 180 countries and 25 markets, a team of 150+ employees and 35+ nationalities, and 1 person missing — you.

We’re on the hunt for the hungriest and most passionate talent out there. If at any point your brain screams “I want in!” while you’re reading this, then consider this the sign you’ve been looking for: we want you too.

The role

We’re looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our Business Intelligence Team reporting to Nicolas Arrivé. You will work on improving our day to day business operations. You understand what kind of insights drive the right action. You have great analytical skills and are good at making people understand what needs to get done and why.

The BI team embeds actionable insights into the business teams, and drives commercial success (improving sales, margin and/or efficiency). Automation is also at the heart of our business practices when value can be extracted at scale.

What will I do?

As a Data Scientist you will play a vital part in defining our company strategy and execution across Payment flow, Paid Marketing, Customer base and product strategy.

You are part of the Business Intelligence team and you are the technical expert in modelling, testing and analytical techniques helping us analysing millions of consumer transactions.

You are modelling from scratch or improving existing statistical models aiming (among other things) at: predicting and explaining Churn, predicting and explaining next likely brand/transaction to happen, existing Marketing Mix Models, automating anomaly detection, existing Lifetime Value prediction model and many more core operational predictive processes. You can articulate the pros and cons of a given approach to numerous stakeholders.

You perform ad hoc advanced strategic analyses and turn these into KPIs that are relevant and easy to understand.

You are a de-facto code reviewer for the rest of the team for the code base you are the most proficient with.

You are improving the automation of some of our reporting tools (Tableau server and front end) for the most important views and KPIs the business relies on to make daily or weekly decisions & you are coaching and mentoring the rest of the team as you see fit on all things technical.

What you have:


3+ years experience in an analytics and/or data-science related field (preferably within the e-commerce industry)
3+ years experience working with structured and unstructured data-sets as well as data extraction tools such as Hive and/or SQL
Solid understanding of testing and modelling statistics (R2, p-value, t-test etc…)
3+ year experience with statistical software such as R, or coding language: Python
3+ years Experience with Data Visualisation tools (like Tableau and PowerBI ideally)
Hands-on experience with setting up test studies: A/B tests, Geo-experimentation and Lift studies



Nice to have:


Advanced knowledge of Customer, Marketing Analytics and modelling such as price elasticity test and formula, Marketing Mix Models, LifeTime Value calculations etc…
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Sociology or similar
Very advanced knowledge of Python or R



What We Offer


30 days of holiday, a great pension scheme and one of the best relocation packages in Amsterdam
Flexible working hours and an office overlooking the Amstel
Macbook Pro or Windows Laptop
Budget for noise-canceling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
Regular parties, celebrations and other events



The process


Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.
Phone interview: One of our recruiters will get in touch to help you both understand if Recharge is the right next move for you.
First interview: You’ll meet with your future line manager (either in person or online) to talk about you, our culture and whether you're a fit for the job.
Assignment & Second interview: Some roles involve a case study. Great! It’s your chance to shine and show us you have what it takes. You’ll present your case study to the Hiring Manager and someone from the team
Third Interview: You’ll meet with a key member of the management team
Offer: You did it! There are only a few tickets available, and this one has your name on it. Welcome to the team.
Show more

What We Offer

  • Flexible working hours and an office overlooking the Amstel
  • Macbook Pro or Windows Laptop
  • Budget for noise-canceling headphones, travel to and from the office, working-from-home and self-learning
  • Free healthy breakfast, lunch and snacks by our in-house chef
  • Free Dutch classes to help out with daily life in the Netherlands
  • Regular parties, celebrations and other events


The process

  • Apply: Want in? Let us know! Apply for a role and help us get to know your best self.

  • Third Interview: You’ll meet with a key member of the management team

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Our client is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

We are dedicated to your professional and personal growth in an environment that values knowledge-sharing and mentorship.

Our team transforms data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions and innovation. We extract valuable information from diverse sources to guide the Management Team and support operational teams in tracking key business metrics. By designing efficient data storage strategies and leveraging advanced technologies like machine learning and AI, we uncover patterns that fuel new processes and smarter business strategies, leading the way toward a data-driven future.

Reporting into the Chief Analytics Officer, this person will be focused on leveraging advanced data analytics and technology to drive business optimization.

What will my daily tasks involve?


Analytical ability for data processing, modeling, and visualization using programming languages and analytics technology (not exhaustive): Python, SQL, AWS (Redshift, S3, SageMaker, Glue), PowerBI.
Ability to use machine learning models and other AI technologies for correlation, clustering, forecasting, and other data analyses.
Ability to learn the business and understand how numbers and KPIs link operations with the company’s future results.
Ability to communicate with different teams and understand information usage needs to help operational areas optimize the business using data models.
Ability to design and structure data architecture and flows within a company.
5+ years of experience with a passion and capability for the technical implementation of necessary analyses and models.


What is expected from me?


Proficiency in programming and associated tools: Python, SQL, Git, AWS/GCP/Azure tools, Data Lakes, among others.
Ability to manipulate data in data frames or similar technologies.
Skill in selecting and using appropriate visualization models.
Ability to apply statistical modelspattern detection, hypothesis testing, regressions, forecastingon data models.


What can I expect from ou client?


A competitive remuneration package
Superior health benefits
Employee cafeteria featuring meals approved by our nutritionist
Wellbeing support through our Happiness Department, including 24/7 medical app access,complimentary nutritional consultations, psychological support, and wellness webinars.
A commitment to professional growth with tailored development plans and opportunities for internal career moves.
An education-rich workplace with access to the Company Academy and language learning opportunities.
A balanced approach to work-life dynamics.
Show more
